Digital Repository.short_description: The core infrastructure that stores, manages, and preserves digital objects and their metadata, ensuring long-term access and maintenance of digital collections.

Metadata Schema.short_description: Structured framework for describing digital objects, including standardized elements for cataloging, discovery, and interoperability across different systems and platforms.

Digital Object.short_description: Any form of electronic content that can be stored, accessed, and preserved, including text, images, audio, video, and complex multimedia materials.

Digital Preservation.short_description: The set of processes and strategies ensuring long-term access to digital content through technology migration, format conversion, and maintenance of authenticity.

Interoperability.short_description: The capability of different systems to exchange data and work together seamlessly through shared standards, protocols, and interfaces.

Collection Development.short_description: The systematic process of building and curating digital collections, including selection, acquisition, organization, and maintenance of digital resources.

Discovery System.short_description: The search and browsing interface that enables users to find, identify, and access digital objects within the library's collections.

Digital Rights Management.short_description: Systems and protocols managing access, usage, and reproduction rights for digital content, protecting intellectual property while enabling authorized use.

Content Management.short_description: The processes and tools for creating, organizing, storing, and delivering digital content throughout its lifecycle within the library system.

User Authentication.short_description: Methods and systems for verifying user identity and authorization levels, controlling access to restricted digital resources and services.

Digital Curation.short_description: The active management and enhancement of digital objects throughout their lifecycle, ensuring their value for current and future use.

Persistent Identifier.short_description: Unique, permanent reference codes assigned to digital objects ensuring consistent access and citation regardless of physical location or system changes.

Harvesting Protocol.short_description: Standardized methods for automatically collecting metadata and content from multiple digital repositories to enable unified access and discovery.

Version Control.short_description: System for tracking and managing changes to digital objects over time, maintaining the integrity and authenticity of content through multiple iterations.

Digital Archive.short_description: Specialized storage system designed for long-term preservation of digital materials, ensuring their authenticity, integrity, and accessibility over time.

Access Control.short_description: Framework governing who can access specific digital resources and under what conditions, implementing security and privacy policies.

Metadata Harvesting.short_description: The automated collection of descriptive information about digital objects from multiple sources to create unified discovery systems.

Digital Collection.short_description: Organized group of digital objects selected and maintained according to specific criteria, serving particular user communities or research needs.

Repository Architecture.short_description: The technical design and infrastructure supporting digital library operations, including storage, processing, and delivery systems.

Format Migration.short_description: The process of converting digital objects from obsolete formats to current ones while maintaining their essential characteristics and accessibility.

Resource Discovery.short_description: Tools and methods enabling users to locate and evaluate digital resources through search, browse, and recommendation functions.

Digital Workflow.short_description: Systematic processes for managing digital objects from acquisition through processing, storage, and delivery to end users.

Preservation Metadata.short_description: Technical and administrative information necessary for long-term management and access to digital objects in the repository.

Content Aggregation.short_description: The process of gathering and organizing digital objects from multiple sources into coherent collections for unified access and discovery.

Search Interface.short_description: The user-facing system providing tools for querying and retrieving digital objects from the repository through various access points.

Digital Asset.short_description: Any digital resource of value to the organization, including both primary content and supporting materials requiring management and preservation.

Indexing System.short_description: Technology for organizing and retrieving digital content through automated analysis and classification of object characteristics and metadata.

Repository Network.short_description: Interconnected system of digital libraries sharing resources and services through standardized protocols and interfaces.

Digital Stewardship.short_description: The responsibility for managing and preserving digital collections over time, ensuring their continued accessibility and usability.

Metadata Standard.short_description: Formal specifications for describing digital objects, enabling consistent documentation and exchange of information across systems.
